channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4592] Caps Lock Has A New Name
item.description: Can you guess what it is?

item.title: [+3430] Things To Say During Sex [Pic]
[+2791] 5 Naked Photos of my Mum [SFW PIC]
item.description: And this is why its never a good idea to forget where you left those naked pictures of yourself.

item.title: [+2075] If You Don't Replace the Toilet Paper Rolls...
[+1793] When you have Chickenpox below the belt ... [pic]
item.description: This guy thought he had reoccurring Chickenpox. He got set straight on Yahoo! Answers.

item.title: [+1772] The 15 Creepiest Vintage Ads Of All Time
item.description: What do murder, pedophilia, suicide and a baby tiger have in common? They have all been used to sell stuff in these amazingly disturbing vintage ads!These are real, untouched advertisements from the good old days.

item.title: [+1731] ROCKET PUBES: Put A Fucking Hairnet Over Your Balls!
[+1533] Why Does Bottled Water Have an Expiration Date?
item.description: Have you ever wondered why that bottle of Poland Spring has a “drink by” date on it when common sense dictates that water doesn’t go bad?

item.title: [+1501] "Shocking": Helen Thomas slams Obama over secrecy
item.description: Veteran White House correspondent Helen Thomas said the Obama administration's way of handling questions from the press and pre-scripting of town hall questions is "shocking." She says in all her years in the White House she's never seen anything like it.

item.title: [+1494] Daily Kos: Scientists Visit the Creation Museum
item.description: Foreign scientists are speechless at the level of inanity proudly displayed.

item.title: [+1461] 2 Year Old Lights Up Cigarette And Smokes It
[+1402] Best Fallout 3 Cosplay Ever - Steel Armor
item.description: This is not your average suit you'll find in stores and certainly looks more than professional work that can be used if Fallout 3 ever gets made into a movie.

item.title: [+1172] How to Force Blizzard to Add LAN to StarCraft II (PIC)
item.description: Make your point in a meaningful way.

item.title: [+1130] Ceiling Porn (SFW)
item.description: (put your trousers back on little fella. it's not what you think) It's incredible how some people live their lives looking either straight ahead or down at the ground, the only ceiling they ever notice being the one above the bed.Luckily it hasn't stopped people designing stunning ceilings.

item.title: [+1100] The Lying, Cheating Federal Reserve
item.description: How Much Money Inflation? Due to a policy of allowing banks to reclassify checking deposits as savings deposits, the Fed increased the money supply 70% from May '08-May '09. The increase in M1 is "only" 16%.

item.title: [+1089] Boy, 14, banned from school for having moustache
item.description: Akaash Iqbal, 14, was left shocked and embarrassed after school bosses told he was not welcome back to classes unless he shaved his facial hair. But his father Asif Mahmood said he was outraged at the Manchester Academy's policy and said it was nonsense they expected a boy his age to begin shaving.

item.title: [+1032] Fox News, WSJ Blow Gasket Over Franken Victory
item.description: Here's a fun dose of schadenfreude. Sen.-elect Al Franken's (D-MN) long-awaited victory in the 2008 Minnesota Senate race seems to have caused quite a lot of stress in the Murdoch-owned press. Remember, this is the same corporation that sued him for a book back in 2003.

item.title: [+907] The Dark Side of Disney
item.description: Disney isn’t always the Happiest Place on Earth. The parks sometimes harbor deep, dark secrets – and we’re not talking the Haunted Mansion or the Tower of Terror. Below are a few sinister secrets Mickey doesn’t want you to know about.

item.title: [+888] Teacher Goes "ALL OUT" for Sex Ed
item.description: A Sacramento teacher attempting to give her class some memories for the summer accidentally included herself having sex on a couch on the DVD she passed out to her entire 5th grade class. One parent was up all night trying to explain it to his child.

item.title: [+856] Canadian HIV vaccine ready for human tests in the U.S.
item.description: An HIV/AIDS vaccine developed in Canada has passed safety tests in animals and the researchers are awaiting approval to begin human trials in the U.S.
